content.user_title: Manage Home Assistant with Expert Workflows
content.value_statement: Managing Home Assistant configurations, automations, and dashboards requires understanding multiple workflows, tools, and best practices. This skill provides expert-level guidance for deployment workflows, remote CLI access, automation verification, and tablet-optimized Lovelace dashboard development.
actual_capabilities: Guide SSH and hass-cli remote access patterns for Home Assistant
Provide git and scp deployment workflows with validation steps
Automate verification protocols for testing automations
Create tablet-optimized Lovelace dashboards with Mushroom cards
Debug template errors and log analysis patterns
Optimize reload vs restart decisions based on change type
limitations: Does not directly execute commands on Home Assistant instances
Requires existing SSH access and hass-cli installation
Does not install or configure Home Assistant integrations
Does not access Home Assistant API directly

use_cases.title: Develop and test automations
use_cases.description: Create new automations with proper YAML syntax, deploy for testing, verify execution, and commit to version control.

use_cases.title: Build tablet control panels
use_cases.description: Design touch-friendly dashboards with grid layouts, Mushroom cards, and dynamic templates for wall-mounted tablets.

use_cases.title: Manage remote HA instances
use_cases.description: Execute remote commands via SSH, validate configurations, analyze logs, and optimize restart vs reload decisions.

prompt_templates.title: Create automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an automation that sends a notification when the front door is left open for more than 5 minutes. Include proper YAML syntax, triggers, conditions, and actions.

prompt_templates.title: Build dashboard
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a dashboard for my 11-inch tablet with lights, thermostat controls, and door status using Mushroom cards in a 3-column grid layout.

prompt_templates.title: Debug template
prompt_templates.prompt: My automation template has a TypeError about comparing str and int. Help me identify the issue and fix the template syntax with proper type filters.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through the complete workflow for deploying automation changes: validation, scp deployment, reload, manual trigger, log verification, and git commit.

output_examples.input: Create an automation that turns on the porch light at sunset and off at sunrise
output: Action: Service call light.turn_on with entity_id light.porch
Action: Service call light.turn_off with entity_id light.porch
Next steps: Deploy via scp, reload, test manually, check logs

best_practices: Always validate configuration with 'ha core check' before restarting
Prefer reload over restart when possible to minimize downtime
Test automations manually by triggering them before relying on scheduled execution
Use scp for rapid iteration and git for final, tested changes
anti_patterns: Restarting Home Assistant without checking configuration validity first
Assuming an automation works without manually triggering and checking logs
Deploying untested changes directly to production git repository
Using dashboard sections view for full-screen content like vacuum maps

faq.question: What tools are required for this skill?
faq.answer: You need SSH access to your Home Assistant instance, hass-cli installed locally, and environment variables set (HASS_SERVER and HASS_TOKEN).

faq.question: What is the difference between scp and git deployment?
faq.answer: Use scp for rapid iteration and testing. Use git for final, tested changes that you want tracked in version control.

faq.question: Does this skill connect directly to Home Assistant?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides guidance for Claude. You need hass-cli installed and configured to execute commands against your Home Assistant instance.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill that only provides guidance. It does not access your files, credentials, or Home Assistant instance directly.

faq.question: Why is my automation not triggering?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing entity_id in trigger, incorrect time conditions, or template errors. Check logs with 'ha core logs' and manually trigger to verify.

faq.question: How does this compare to Home Assistant YAML editors?
faq.answer: This skill provides workflow expertise and best practices. It works with any YAML editor by guiding proper syntax, deployment, testing, and verification steps.
